Download NASA-POWER Agroclimatology Variables for a Given Region and Return a Tidy Data Frame

Source: R/get_region.R

Download NASA-POWER (Prediction of Worldwide Energy Resource) agroclimatology data for a region given the four corners of the region of interest for a range of days to years.

The agroclimatology data are satellite and modelled derived solar and meteorological data. The POWER website describes the data as:

  • Near real-time 1° x 1° daily time series of solar radiation and meteorology

  • Daily total solar radiation from July 1, 1983 through near real-time

  • Daily averaged air temperature (average/minimum/maximum/dew point) from January 1, 1983 through near real-time

  • Daily averaged precipitation from January 1997 through February 2013

  • Global coverage on a 1° latitude by 1° longitude grid

get_region(lonlat = NULL, vars = c("T2M", "T2MN", "T2MX", "RH2M", "toa_dwn",
  "swv_dwn", "lwv_dwn", "DFP2M", "RAIN", "WS10M"), stdate = "1983-1-1",
  endate = Sys.Date())

Arguments

lonlat

A length-4 numeric vector giving the decimal degree minimum longitude, maximum longitude, minimum latitude, and maximum latitude in that order for the region data to download.
vars

Weather variables to download, defaults to all available. Valid variables are:

  • toa_dwn - Average top-of-atmosphere insolation (MJ/m^2/day)

  • swv_dwn - Average insolation incident on a horizontal surface (MJ/m^2/day)

  • lwv_dwn - Average downward longwave radiative flux (MJ/m^2/day)

  • T2M - Average air temperature at 2m above the surface of the Earth (degrees C)

  • T2MN - Minimum air temperature at 2m above the surface of the Earth (degrees C)

  • T2MX - Maximum air temperature at 2m above the surface of the Earth (degrees C)

  • RH2M - Relative humidity at 2m above the surface of the Earth (%)

  • DFP2M - Dew/Frost point temperature at 2m above the surface of the Earth (degrees C)

  • RAIN - Average precipitation (mm/day)

  • WS10M - Wind speed at 10m above the surface of the Earth (m/s)
stdate

Starting date for download, defaults to 1983-01-01 (there are no earlier data).
endate

End date for download, defaults to current date. Note that data is often available only with a lag of days to a month or more. The last available data will be silently returned with NA for any values not yet reported.

Value

A tidy data.frame object of the requested variable(s) for the requested region.

Note

The order in which the vars are listed will be the order of the columns in the data frame that get_region() returns.

References

https://power.larc.nasa.gov/documents/Agroclimatology_Methodology.pdf

Examples

# NOT RUN {
# Get POWER data for Australia for 1/1/2017
nasa <- get_region(lonlat = c(112.91972, 159.256088, -55.11694, -9.221099),
                   stdate = "2017-1-1", endate = "2017-1-1")
# }
